ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were openings without bringing a mouthful to it. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not open my mouth without bringing a mouthful to it,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.4_0: One should not open one’s mouth without bringing a mouthful to it.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, opens his mouth without bringing a mouthful to it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.8_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk41:1.9_0: The first training rule is finished.
